title: Week’s Best: Suing the SEC, Brokers in Limbo
text:
Seven states and the District of Columbia sued the SEC this week to overturn Regulation Best Interest. The plaintiffs – New York, California, Connecticut, Delaware, Maine, New Mexico and Oregon – also name SEC Chairman Jay Clayton in the suit, which claims Reg BI undermines critical protections for retail investors, increases investor confusion about brokers versus advisors, and makes it easier for brokers to market themselves as “trusted advisers” while still being able to give conflicted advice.

In other wealth management...
description: Barron’s Advisor rounds up the week’s top wealth management news.
